Dream control could lead to improved mental health: By learning to control our dreams, we could potentially better manage our emotions and stress levels. This could result in improved mental health overall.

Enhanced problem-solving skills: Controlling our dreams could allow us to practice problem-solving in a safe and controlled environment. This could translate to better problem-solving skills in our waking lives.
Increased creativity: Dream control could allow us to tap into our subconscious and access new and unique ideas. This could lead to increased creativity in our waking lives.
Improved memory: By controlling our dreams, we could potentially improve our memory by better retaining information from our dreams.

Increased self-awareness: Controlling our dreams could allow us to gain a deeper understanding of ourselves and our subconscious thoughts. This could lead to increased self-awareness and personal growth.
